An ostracon is a piece of pottery, usually broken off from a vase or other 
earthenware vessel. In an archaeological or epigraphical context, ostraca refer to 
sherds or even ... Ostraca were typically small, covered with just a few words or a 
small picture .... In these inscriptions Greek letters are used, with some other 
signs.

search_results.snippet:
In archaeology, a sherd, or more precisely, potsherd, is commonly a historic or 
prehistoric fragment of pottery, although the term is occasionally used to refer to 
fragments of stone and glass vessels, as well. Occasionally, a piece of broken 
pottery may be referred to as a shard.
